p: During the MERS-CoV epidemics, several studies were aimed at understanding the pathogenic mechanisms underlying the severe and often fatal pneumonia were performed. Available data suggest that MERS-CoV infection shares some immunological aspects of SARS-CoV infection, in terms of involvement of the chemokine system. First, an increase in the serum levels of CXCL10 when compared to controls was observed also in MERS-CoV patients. More importantly, a persistent CXCL10 increase was associated with disease severity [ 90].
